resources.string: Maulana Jalaluddin Rumi was a 13th century Persian poet, an Islamic dervish and a Sufi mystic. He is regarded as one of the greatest spiritual masters and poetical intellects. Born in 1207 AD, he belonged to a family of learned theologians. He made use of everyday life’s circumstances to describe the spiritual world. Rumi’s poems have acquired immense popularity, especially among the Persian speakers of Afghanistan, Iran and Tajikistan. Numerous poems written by the great poet have been translated to different languages.

"In Mevleviism,Shab-i Arus is the night of Celaleddin-i Rumi's death.Mevlana Celaleddin Rumi calls this night "Wedding Night",which he regards as the night of joining to God. Rumi's death anniversaries in the week of December 17,and International Commemoration ceremonies began to be called as "Shab-i Arus" among the public.Every year in Konya(Turkey), traditionally Memorial ceremonies are held for Mevlana's death day.One of the his poet,he said that: Do not cry for me, if you fall into the trap of the devil, then cry.. When you see my dead,do not say it is a separation!No, it is not a separation,it is my meeting,it's time to meet my love(God).It is my wedding night!
